page.title: 19The Glastonbury Zodiac
page.content: The Glastonbury Zodiac was discovered in 1925 after aerial photoghaphs had been taken. Modelled in relief by hills and part-outlined by streams following contours, roads, canals, footpaths etc, the 12 zodiac signs are arranged in correct order and proportion in a circle. It has also been suggested that this is the Round Table with Arthur (Sagittarius), Guinevere (Virgo), Merlin and the Chief Knights arranged in a majestic circle. Much of the upper part of Sagittarius or Arthur, whose shadow stretches for over 5 miles, covers the eastern part of our D_Block. We have also got some of Pisces (to the west), the horn of Capricorn (to the east) and possibly a wing feather of the Phoenix (Aquarius).
